titleStmt.title: Patro-scholastiko-dikaiōsis, or, A justification of the fathers and the schoolmen shewing, that they are not self-condemned for denying the positivity of sin. Being an answer to so much of Mr. Tho. Pierce's book, called Autokatakrisis, as doth relate to the foresaid opinion. By Hen: Hickman, fellow of Magdalene Colledge, Oxon.
titleStmt.author: Hickman, Henry, d. 1692.

titleStmt.title: Patro-scholastiko-dikaiōsis, or, A justification of the fathers and the schoolmen shewing, that they are not self-condemned for denying the positivity of sin. Being an answer to so much of Mr. Tho. Pierce's book, called Autokatakrisis, as doth relate to the foresaid opinion. By Hen: Hickman, fellow of Magdalene Colledge, Oxon.
titleStmt.author: Hickman, Henry, d. 1692.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by A. Lichfield, fot [sic] Joh. Adams, and Edw. Forrest,

notesStmt.note: The words "Patro-scholastiko-dikaiōsis" and "Autokatakrisis" are in Greek characters on title page.
Reproduction of the original in the St. David's College Library, Lampeter, Wales.
